column5: CALGARY  Alberta A Canadian regulator's plan to assess indirect carbon emissions when considering TransCanada Corp's  Energy East pipeline application sets a harsh precedent for future projects  the Alberta government and supporters of the pipeline said on Friday.

column4: TransCanada may abandon Energy East pipe facing tougher review
column5: CALGARY  Alberta TransCanada Corp  seeks to suspend the application for its Energy East pipeline for 30 days and may abandon the project  the company said on Thursday  weeks after Canada's National Energy Board (NEB) announced a tougher review process.

column4: UPDATE 3-TransCanada may abandon Energy East pipe facing tougher review
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Sept 7 TransCanada Corp seeks to suspend the application for its Energy East pipeline for 30 days and may abandon the project  the company said on Thursday  weeks after Canada's National Energy Board (NEB) announced a tougher review process.

column4: Options market seeks cover  and exposure  as Hurricane Irma nears
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 8 Equity option traders are seeking ways to profit from and protect their investments against expected damage caused by Hurricane Irma  one of the most powerful Atlantic storms in a century as it closes in on Florida.

column4: Orlando theme parks brace for Hurricane Irma
column5: Sept 8 Walt Disney World said its theme park in Florida would remained closed on Sunday and Monday  joining a growing list of top Orlando attractions that are bracing for Hurricane Irma  which is poised to strike the state on Sunday.

column4: UPDATE 1-TV viewership drops for NBC'S first NFL game
column5: Sept 8 The NFL kickoff game broadcast on Thursday night on NBC  a win by the Kansas City Chiefs over the New England Patriots  attracted 21.8 million TV viewers  down more than 13 percent from last year's opening game  data from NBC and Nielsen showed.

column4: Disney  Comcast shares fall on disappointing forecasts
